relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
I like the fact that they have a lit path for students with night classes and that there are safety phones placed every so often in case of an emergency.
The clubs seem very involved with the school and students here.
All students would benefit from Fresno State University.
I like the legend of the Rose Garden.
I feel like tuition is too high for a full time student with 12 units.
There is a lot to be involved in and the campus life seems fun. The football games are enjoyable in the student section.
I do not live in the dorms.
I love the open and student driven environment here. The classes are well kept and the campus is pleasing. I give this school a 10/10.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {17471=CSU, Fresno has one of the largest libraries in California, and the nation which over one-million-plus books including various other resources. We have a great athletics department, namely our men's baseball team which won the NCAA Tournament in 2008. We also have a fantastic and top-notch music department., 68405=You get out of your education what you put in. I have learned a great deal since I started attending CSU Fresno as a first time freshman in 2009. There is free tutoring in the learning center located on the bottom floor of the library and professors also offer plenty of assistance to struggling students. The textbooks are informative and can usually be rented at an affordable price in the library. Overall, CSU Fresno offers a great learning environment. I'm definitely learning a lot., 200927=The dining hall was awesome at first! I was excited about the all you can eat aspect. The breakfast omelets were to die for, and Thursday pizza was exceptional. However, they started making meals that NO ONE wanted. They would repeat a lot of things and it got old fast. I stopped wanting to go around February. Some days were better than others., 88318=As CSU tuition rises, State Universities such as Fresno State become more expensive. as of 2011,the prices for next fall including tuition,housing, books and other costs are estimated at 22,000 total. However, as prices for schooling goes, its a great bargain and a great investment. If you like Fresno and places like it, then this will be a good investment for you., 134469=Tuition has gone up SO much since I started there in 2009, there are hardly any classes to choose from., 545063=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 405518=There the rock music play at the food court and some kind of festival in April.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Ashley from Fresno, CA 03/21/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 12 out of 12 people found this review useful. 3 of 133 Categories Comments Campus Safety Fresno is naturally a dangerous place, but the on campus police are very effective at patrolling. There are also spots about campus with emergency buttons that will immediately call the police. These precautions make the students feel better about walking at night. Greek Life Greek life is a big part of Fresno. There are something like 26 sororities on campus, and they are your best bet for a social group with similar interests. Clubs and Activities Between the array of clubs and the students who are excited about them, there is always something to dedicate your time to. Great for these types of students students pursuing agricultural carreers should definately consider Fresno State as a top choice. The school is excellent
